item.title: Coming Soon
item.description: Its always better to give rather than receive, so as time allows I will be writing some tutorials on various topics.

item.title: CyberSecLab
item.description: Inspired by Rob and his Shiva project to automatically create an attack ready ubuntu host, I decided to expand on the concept and automate the deployment of not only an attack host, but an environment where you can perform all manner of cyber-sec activities from anywhere you choose has an internet connection. Activities such as: Windows Malware Analysis. Exploit Development CTFs OS, Tool and Technique Exploration

item.title: Relaunch
item.description: And so, With the help of Hugo the site has been relaunched. Look out for posts on: Hacking The Cloud Reverse Engineering Coding Hardware Drones There will also be the odd post about Climbing, Motorcycles and other goings on too

item.title: AWS Solutions Architect - Associate
item.description: Excellent course to learn the intricacies of AWS and round out the knowledge gained on the Job.

item.title: AWS Solutions Architect - Professional
item.description: Obtained a much deeper understanding of AWS and especially its capabilities and limitations with respect to securing cloud workloads

item.title: About Me
item.description: Hi, I’m Chris. I am a Hacker, Developer and Geek. I have a passion for all things Cyber Security, but my main areas of focus are in Hardware “hacking” (making and breaking) and the Cloud. You can never know everything, but knowledge is power; so I always strive to learn something new as often as family, work and life allow. I am also a motorcyclist and boulderer when not chasing around after 2 kids and my darling wife.

item.title: Attacking Network Protocols: A Hacker's Guide to Capture, Analysis, and Exploitation
item.description: Deep Dive into the process of attacking a network communications protocol. Attacking Network Protocols: A Hacker’s Guide to Capture, Analysis, and Exploitation

item.title: CEH
item.description: An excellent introduction to the ways a hacker works to compromise a system.

item.title: CHFI
item.description: A very insightful course into art of computer forensics and the techniques that are used to catch hackers. Very interesting to take the knowledge gained here and work out ways to evade them, excellent course to take that stage further and develop the adversarial mindset.

item.title: CISSP
item.description: The Gold standard for information security professionals, I would advise anybody working in IT Security to do this course. Its benefit lies in understanding, as a techie I gained a deeper understanding and appreciation of how the Policy and process side of Security works.

item.title: Hack The Box
item.description: HackTheBox - More sharpening of skills, but with challenges to test a particular area as well such as RE, crypto etc.

item.title: Hobbies
item.description: This is a home for Hobbies I am or have dabbled with… FPV Drones My hobby as a First Person View Flying of Drones e.g. Quadcopters

item.title: My Study List
item.description: The home of my collected learning; past, present and future. Here I document the courses & certifications, blogs, books and other resources I have used since I got onto the Cyber Security path Courses (upcoming and in Progress) Penetration Testing With Kali The precursor course to the OSCP examination. Its very difficult to put into words how much I have learned from this course so far, and there is always more to learn #TryHarder.

item.title: Over The Wire
item.description: OverTheWire Wargaming site to practice exploitation skills

item.title: Practical Reverse Engineering: x86, x64, ARM, Windows Kernel, Reversing Tools, and Obfuscation
item.description: Advanced reversed engineering topics. Practical Reverse Engineering: x86, x64, ARM, Windows Kernel, Reversing Tools, and Obfuscation

item.title: Projects
item.description: This is a home for Projects I am working on. CyberSecLab Terraform, Ansible and Python scripts for an offensive security lab in AWS Others Links to resources I use in sharpening and enhancing my Offensive security skills when I am in between projects.

item.description: Pages Just some links to pages I have found useful across the internet. PentesterAcademy HackTheBox The Many Hats Club Blackroomsec 0x00sec Pentesterlabs Hacksplaining BrightTalk Azeria Labs CodeArcana Radare2 Gitbook Cheatography Github Repos Useful Repos from Github Awesome Hacking Reverse Engineering Ninja Admins Awesome CyberSkills Ropper JohnTheRipper

item.description: Introductory Text on Reverse Engineering Reversing: Secrets of Reverse Engineering

item.title: Root Me
item.description: Root-Me - Wargaming and challenges to practice a wide range of skills

item.description: The IDA Pro Book V2. The IDAPro Book

item.title: Vulnhub
item.description: VulnHub - To support my PWK/OSCP course and generally sharpen those offensive security skills I have been working through some of the machines on here.
